iati-activity.title: ALTERNATIVE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM IN SUPPORT DRUG CONTROL
iati-activity.description: AGRIBUSINESS SECTOR BASED ON SUSTAINABLE NATURAL RESOURCE

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (World Vision)
iati-activity.description: Mosoq Ayllu Area Development Project. The objective of the project is to ensure that the children_ families and communities are equipped with capacities to have a better quality of life through the practice of fair and equal relations with hope for future. The project will focus on improving child education_ child health and child rights in the area. Enhancing the economic situation of the families as well empowering the communities are important components of the programme.

iati-activity.title: USE OF APPROPRIATE TECHNOLOGIES IN THE PROCESSING OF ANDEAN CROPS
iati-activity.description: TO SUPPORT SMALL NETWORK OF MICRO ENTERPRISES WHICH WILL PROCESS CONVENTIONAL GRAINS PRODUCED BY SMALL FARMERS.

iati-activity.title: NGO SUPPORT/EDUCATION ON SEXUAL AND REPRODUCTIVE HEALTH IN SCHOOLS
iati-activity.description: EDUCATION ON SEXUAL AND REPRODUCTIVE HEALTH IN EVENING SCHOOLS OF LIMA

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Youth leadership, cultural identity and occupational
iati-activity.description: The area where the project is planned to be executed is one of the poorest in Peru with low levels of the quality of life. One of the principal problems is the lack of culturally sensible leadership skills in order to strenghten the local organizations, which in their turn, could offer alternatives to environmentally sustainable development in the local communities.In general terms, the project will contribute to reduce poverty and to improve the quality of life of the rural adn indigenous communities of the Peruvian rain forest located in the valleys of the Central Huallaga and lower Mayo rivers. Specifically, the project will work with youth leaders to improve their management and leadership skills, rescuing their cultural traditions so they will not be forgotten and disappear. The project will also work towards the self-sustainability of the proposal.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Lima
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs at MFA, related to ODA. These costs cover all costs that can be counted (in full or percentually) as ODA at the Ministry for Foreign Affairs in Finland. Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Lima

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (SASK)
iati-activity.description: The project aims at improving the working conditions in mining industry in Peru. The focus is to create a strong national level trade union for the mining sector that will defend particularly the rights of sub-contracted workers. Other objectives of the project are to train union leaders, recruit new members and campaign to eliminate the employerÂ´s right to intermediate in the collection of trade union fees.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (World Vision)
iati-activity.description: Proyecto Vida hiv aids. The projects aims at developing helathy life skills and sexual habits of th youth in order to prevent hiv and aids. The target group is teenagers of 12-17 years and the project works in 9 area development programmes in Peru.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (World Vision)
iati-activity.description: El Salvador Area Development Project. The programme is aimed at contributing to impoverished children and their families to be empowered to reach well-being. This incluced work on improving educational quality_ nutrition of children as well as the economic situation of the families. Awareness raising on child rights and participation of children is also an important component of the programme.

location.name: In slums of El Salvadori and Maria del Triunfo_ Lima

Enhancing the economic situation of the families as well empowering the communities are important components of the programme.

location.name: Acos Vinchos_ Pacaycasa and Quinua provinces_ Ayacucho department_ Peru

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Promotion of ecological awareness in Peruvian Rainforest
iati-activity.description: In general terms_ the project will contribute to reduce poverty and improve the quality of life of the rural and indigenous communities of the Peruvian rain forest located in the valleys of the rivers Central Huallaga_ Lower Mayo (First proposal)_ Ucayali region and Apurimac-Ene_ Pichis-Palcazy Valleys (second proposal). Specifically_ the project will work with youth leaders to improve their management and leadership skills_ rescuing their cultural traditions so they will not be forgotten and disappear. The project will also work towards the self-sustainibility of the proposal through the development of legal environmental-friendly developments.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Vigilancia
iati-activity.description: In the project the aim is to educate 2500 young people according to the Hiv/Aids and other sexually transmitted diseases. The intention is to give education in 12 secondary schools of Trujillo during three years with the pyramid method where the professionals of health care give education to leader students and they again give it to other students. The aim is to change the sexual behavior of young people and reduce for exemple the amount of teenagers pregnancies. There is a pilot project implemented in 2003-2004.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Wellbeing for the elderly
iati-activity.description: Health professionals will be trained in geriatrics and members of the partner NGO in self care in university programmes.

location.name: Peru, La Libertad region, Trujillo Province

iati-activity.title: Finampo; Finnish-Peruvian project for increased capacity of Senam
iati-activity.description: Finampo, Finnish Peruvian project for increased capacity of SENAMHI to provide climatological and meteorological services.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Youth and community empowerment for integral health promotion
iati-activity.description: Peruvian leaders have developed a major concern about the high incidence of health problems that could be prevented with the participation of the community and schools. As part of these efforts, CEDRO has collaborated with Peruvian Health and Education Ministries developing strategies to prevent drug abuse and violence in school and families, especially in zones known as âhigh risk zonesâ. The project aims to increase the awareness and information that will contribute to improve preventive health in children and youth at risk in Metropolitan Lima, specifically in the suburban districts of RÃ­mac and La Victoria, fostering the involvement and participation of students, children and youth, as well as school authorities and parentsâ organizations. The implementation uses two main strategic lines: 1)intervention in community and schools 2)intervention in safe spaces for youth at high risk.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
iati-activity.description: ConservaciÃ³n participativa de orquideas fase II. Participative conservation and sustainable use of the orchid Phragmipedia kovachii, endemic species of San Martin region./ San Martin (North Western Amazonia).The project seeks to save the species from extinction and help to preserve the whole forest in the area (a natural reserve, legally protected but threatened in practice by extractive activities of surrounding population) through the sensitization of local people to get them involved at the conservation of the few last patch relicts of the orchid species in wilderness while offering to them the possibility of getting monetary incomes from eco tourism and in vitro cultivation of the endangered orchid.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
iati-activity.description: GuÃ­a de educaciÃ³n ambiental para maestros de escuela. Publishing a 3rd -and updated- edition of the handbook on environmental education for school teachers' use in cooperation with Ministries of Education and Environment/ Peru, whole country. One of the main factors for environmental destruction and biodiversity loss in Peru is its people's lack of information about environmental issues. This handbook -the first of its kind- aims at building environmental awareness among the new generations since their school age.

iati-activity.title: Capacity Building for the Development of Paiche Farming in San Martin
iati-activity.description: Capacity Building for the Development of Paiche Farming in the San Martin Region by the Finnish Game and Fisheries Research Institute. Special focus on Breeding Strategy and Feed Development. The Regional Government of San MartÃ­n (GORESAM) has clearly outlined the development objectives for fisheries and aquaculture in the region. This project responds to those objectives.

iati-activity.title: PERU/Life W Conservation a Ecological Restoration of Atiquipa
iati-activity.description: The project aims for the conservation, restoration and sustainable use of the Atiquipa Lomas. The project emcompasses following components: 1) biodiversity conservation, 2) water resources management and 3) climate change adaptation. Overall Objective is to conserve and recover native lomas forest in Atiquipa and ensure its conservation through active participation of local actors. The project aims to improve the capacity of the lomas to sustain livelihoods through strengthened organizational capacities at the local level for sustainable management of natural resources and adaptation to climate change.

iati-activity.title: PER/Recycling Center of Cuna Nazareth
iati-activity.description: The project establishes a recycling centre and trains unemployed young people to be professionals in recycling in Pachacamac, poor outskirts of Lima. The aim is to create a training system for recycling. The established centre sells material to industry and repaired items at low price to people in the area. The purpose is to make the centre self-sustaining during the project and to make profit in the future. The project also aims to improve environmental awareness of the people in Pachacamac.

iati-activity.title: Promoting bioactive compounds in the Andean food materials and diets
iati-activity.description: The objective of this capacity- building project is to improve the skills of UNALMâs (Universidad Nacional Agraria) academic staff to produce and disseminate new knowledge to academia, authorities, consumers and industry about properties of Andean and Amazonian native edible plants and their use in promotion of nutrition. Peru has a vast amount of unexploited native food crops with potentially high nutritious and health-promoting properties. There is an acute need to characterize the potential health benefits of native food plants and promote their more efficient use for improvement of nutrition of Andean and Amazonian people. These activities require building of human and infrastructure capacity in the field of food and nutrition sciences.

location.name: Hanke toteutetaan Perussa, mutta sillÃ¤ on vaikuttavuutta myÃ¶s muihin Andien maihin.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
iati-activity.description: Support for the implementation of the Management Plan of the OJOS DE AGUA FOREST conservancy concession, set up to protect the headwaters of the area, threatened by deforestation/ San Martin (North Western Amazonia). The Ojos de Agua forest covers 2 400 Has of public land over a hill range. The farmers at the feet of those hills have realized that the favourable climate of their valley and specially its water provision depend on the existence of that forest over the hills. They also got aware that, as the hills are public land, risk to be deforested not only by Andean colonizers but even by themselves as individuals looking to extend their properties. So they decided to reunite as an association to collectively take care of the hills.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
iati-activity.description: Communal conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity at Pichis Valley. To alleviate poverty among indigenous communities by introducing the production of non wooden commercial items from communal forests outputs/ Eastern lowlands of Cerro de Pasco (Central Amazonia). This would be a continuation of a former one agreed as a complement to another Finnish funded project implemented by Conservation International, as a part of cooperation with DEVIDA (Peruvian national anti drug agency), on communal forest management as alternative development in contrast to illegal coca leaf plantations.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
iati-activity.description: Setting up a network of regional and central governments' institutions acting for conflict management and prevention; and building political concensus for the continuity --beyond the incoming elections-- of the conflict management regional units created in former phases of the project./ Cajamarca (Northern Andes); San Martin (North Western Amazonia); Arequipa and Junin (Southern and Central Andes). This proposal seeks to consolidate the achievements of two successful former projects aiming at building capacities inside the Regional Governments, allowing that conflicts be detected and managed at local level, before they grow critical. There is a growing demand for specialized capacity on the matter, but the number of experts is still short and concentrated in the capital city, while conflicts tend to emerge inside the country and most frequently in the Andean regions.
iati-activity.sector: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
iati-activity.description: Regional Natural Reserve and Cordillera Azul National Park, through the promotion of sustainable management of two native palms for the production of vegetal ivory and brooms. The communities would be getting involved in the extraction of non wooden forestry products with good commercial demand, which would give them a source of incomes alternative to logging or deforesting for introducing livestock./ San Martin (North Eastern Amazonia).

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
iati-activity.description: Capacity building for the Ombudsman's office to be better prepared to mediate in environmental conflicts and supervise the proper enforcement of environmental norms/ Peru, whole country. Environmental conflicts are multiplying across the country as a consequence of past bad practices by private companies, mainly in the mining industry, but also as a consequence of the already present effects of climate change, like the growing scarcity of water. In many cases, it is a matter of lack of dialogue or inadequate channels for it between entrepreneurs and local people. The ombudsman's office has become a key actor for preventing conflicts as it is sometimes the only one that is trusted and respected by all parts.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
iati-activity.description: Introducing environmental matters like climate change and sustainable use of biodiversity into regional and municipal electoral debate in Amazonian region, through a forum assembling political candidates with local scholars, entrepreneurs, and representatives of civil society/ Loreto (Northern Amazonia).

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
iati-activity.description: Participative conservation and sustainable use of the orchid Phragmipedia kovachii, endemic species of San Martin region./ San Martin (North Western Amazonia). The project seeks to save the species from extinction and help to preserve the whole forest in the area (a natural reserve, legally protected but threatened in practice by extractive activities of surrounding population) through the sensitization of local people to get them involved at the conservation of the few last patch relicts of the orchid species in wilderness while offering to them the possibility of getting monetary incomes from eco tourism and in vitro cultivation of the endangered orchid.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
iati-activity.description: Unallocated amount, will be allocated in 2010.
